gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 16,19]]Jesus said to the Pharisees: "There was a rich man who dressed in purple garments and fine linen and dined sumptuously each day.
[[Lc 16,20]]And lying at his door was a poor man named Lazarus, covered with sores,
[[Lc 16,21]]who would gladly have eaten his fill of the scraps that fell from the rich man's table. Dogs even used to come and lick his sores.
[[Lc 16,22]]When the poor man died, he was carried away by angels to the bosom of Abraham. The rich man also died and was buried,
[[Lc 16,23]]and from the netherworld, where he was in torment, he raised his eyes and saw Abraham far off and Lazarus at his side.
[[Lc 16,24]]And he cried out, 'Father Abraham, have pity on me. Send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am suffering torment in these flames.'
[[Lc 16,25]]Abraham replied, 'My child, remember that you received what was good during your lifetime while Lazarus likewise received what was bad; but now he is comforted here, whereas you are tormented.
[[Lc 16,26]]Moreover, between us and you a great chasm is established to prevent anyone from crossing who might wish to go from our side to yours or from your side to ours.'
[[Lc 16,27]]He said, 'Then I beg you, father, send him to my father's house,
[[Lc 16,28]]for I have five brothers, so that he may warn them, lest they too come to this place of torment.'
[[Lc 16,29]]But Abraham replied, 'They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.'
[[Lc 16,30]]He said, 'Oh no, father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.'
[[Lc 16,31]]Then Abraham said, 'If they will not listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if someone should rise from the dead.'"

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 146,7]]The LORD keeps faith forever,
secures justice for the oppressed, 
gives food to the hungry. 
the LORD sets captives free.

[[Ps 146,8]]The LORD gives sight to the blind. 
The LORD raises up those who were bowed down; 
the LORD loves the just.
[[Ps 146,9]]The LORD protects strangers. 

The fatherless and the widow he sustains, 
but the way of the wicked he thwarts.
[[Ps 146,10]]The LORD shall reign forever; 
your God, O Zion, through all generations. Alleluia.

first_reading.title: Book of Amos
first_reading.text:
[[Am 6,1]]Thus says the LORD the God of hosts: Woe to the complacent in Zion!
[[Am 6,4]]Lying upon beds of ivory, stretched comfortably on their couches, They eat lambs taken from the flock, and calves from the stall!
[[Am 6,5]]Improvising to the music of the harp, like David, they devise their own accompaniment.
[[Am 6,6]]They drink wine from bowls and anoint themselves with the best oils; yet they are not made ill by the collapse of Joseph!
[[Am 6,7]]Therefore, now they shall be the first to go into exile, and their wanton revelry shall be done away with.

second_reading.text:
[[1_Tm 6,11]]But you, man of God, pursue righteousness, devotion, faith, love, patience, and gentleness.
[[1_Tm 6,12]]Compete well for the faith. Lay hold of eternal life, to which you were called when you made the noble confession in the presence of many witnesses.
[[1_Tm 6,13]]I charge (you) before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who gave testimony under Pontius Pilate for the noble confession,
[[1_Tm 6,14]]to keep the commandment without stain or reproach until the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ
[[1_Tm 6,15]]that the blessed and only ruler will make manifest at the proper time, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
[[1_Tm 6,16]]who alone has immortality, who dwells in unapproachable light, and whom no human being has seen or can see. To him be honor and eternal power. Amen.
